Site colors

Utility Class Usage

You can use every color as a utility class for static and hover states. These are the prefixes that are available;

bg-<color> = Background color

text-<color> = Text color

border-<color> = Border color

Refer to Tailwind CSS docs for full details.

<prefix>-color-black,$color-black
#000000
<prefix>-color-white,$color-white
#ffffff
<prefix>-color-transparent,$color-transparent
rgba(255, 255, 255, 0)
<prefix>-color-blue,$color-blue
#184e9e
<prefix>-color-blue-bright,$color-blue-bright
#118df0
<prefix>-color-blue-dark,$color-blue-dark
#112e51
<prefix>-color-blue-light,$color-blue-light
#e1eeff
<prefix>-color-green,$color-green
#05ce7c
<prefix>-color-green-dark,$color-green-dark
#094727
<prefix>-color-green-mid,$color-green-mid
#0d6b3b
<prefix>-color-green-light,$color-green-light
#d4ffe7
<prefix>-color-grey-dark,$color-grey-dark
#172129
<prefix>-color-grey-light,$color-grey-light
#d1d5d9
<prefix>-color-grey-lightest,$color-grey-lightest
#eef3f7
<prefix>-color-grey-mid,$color-grey-mid
#505c66
<prefix>-color-pink,$color-pink
#f1647c
<prefix>-color-pink-light,$color-pink-light
#f1b3bd
<prefix>-color-purple,$color-purple
#4c2c92
<prefix>-color-red,$color-red
#c6252b
<prefix>-color-yellow-access,$color-yellow-access
#fbb720
<prefix>-color-yellow-light,$color-yellow-light
#ffe6a9
